meanings.definition: To subject (a target) to a sweeping gunfire from a flank or oblique angle.
meanings.sent1: The soldiers enfiladed the enemy's position, firing from the side.
meanings.sent2: The sharpshooters enfiladed the advancing troops, catching them off guard.
meanings.sent3: The squirrels enfiladed the bird feeder, stealing all the seeds!
meanings.sent4: Her piercing gaze enfiladed through the crowd, searching for her lost friend.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight enfiladed through the trees, creating a beautiful pattern on the forest floor.

meanings.definition: To position (troops or weapons) so as to be able to fire along the length of (a target).
meanings.sent1: The general enfiladed the cannons to target the enemy's fort.
meanings.sent2: The archers enfiladed their arrows, ready to rain down on the approaching army.
meanings.sent3: The chef enfiladed the ingredients on the cutting board, preparing for a delicious meal.
meanings.sent4: His words enfiladed her heart, leaving a lasting impact on her emotions.
meanings.sent5: The artist enfiladed the brushstrokes on the canvas, creating a masterpiece.

meanings.definition: To be positioned so as to be able to fire along the length of a target.
meanings.sent1: The sniper enfiladed on the rooftop, aiming at the distant target.
meanings.sent2: The tank enfiladed on the hill, ready to engage the enemy below.
meanings.sent3: The cat enfiladed on the windowsill, watching the birds outside.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts enfiladed on the problem, trying to find a solution.
meanings.sent5: The spotlight enfiladed on the stage, highlighting the lead actor.
